input:
Journey post: Leaving my job and failing for 15 months. Finally hitting $10k in one month.

AI Builders Bootcamp: $9,265.48
Medium (blog): $894.52
YouTube: $542.73
Consulting calls: $363.21
Total: $10,826.72
writing_steps:
Step 1:
Purpose: Share a behind-the-scenes breakdown of my first $10k month as an independent creator after leaving full-time work, using real numbers to serve as a practical roadmap for others seeking to make a living from AI/tech skills.

Target audience: Aspiring solopreneurs, AI educators, creators, and anyone interested in the transition from traditional employment to independent income streams.

Step 2:
Wireframe:
[Hook: Direct, curiosity-driven callout on the 15 months of failure, then first $10k+ month.]
[Body: Short personal context (leaving job, reality of 15 months “failing”), then transparent revenue breakdown by income stream with numbers. Wrap up with a practical takeaway: the importance of stacking multiple income streams, embracing phase of experimentation.]
[CTA: What did your income breakdown look like on your first big milestone month? If you haven’t hit your goal yet, which stream are you most interested in exploring?]

Step 3:
Body:

After leaving my full-time job, I spent 15 months failing to make a sustainable independent income. It felt like endless trial and error—new ideas, changed directions, lots of learning.

This month, things finally clicked: $10,826.72 across four streams.

Here's the breakdown:

- AI Builders Bootcamp: $9,265.48
- Medium (blog): $894.52
- YouTube: $542.73
- Consulting calls: $363.21

Total: $10,826.72

The biggest shift? Stacking multiple income streams, not betting everything on one. Most experiments didn’t work, but each one helped build the skills and audience I needed to get here.

It’s still early days, but this is proof that slow, consistent experimentation can pay off—eventually.

Step 4:
CTA: What’s your own income breakdown from independent projects? If you’re just starting, which income stream do you want to focus on first?

Step 5:
Step 5A: Brainstorm hook directions
- [Failure-to-success arc] “15 months of failure, then my first $10k month—real numbers inside”
- [Literal number curiosity] “How I made $10,826.72 in one month (after a year of no traction)”
- [Breakdown preview] “Here’s exactly where my first $10k independent month came from”
- [Personal honesty] “I left my job and floundered for 15 months. Here’s what actually worked.”

Step 5B: Label/notes for each direction
- [Failure-to-success] Hooks readers by teasing the pain and the payoff, then immediately gets to real data.
- [Literal numbers] Pure numbers focus—invites builders and solopreneurs who value specificity.
- [Breakdown preview] For people looking for actionable breakdowns.
- [Personal honesty] Connects as an honest story, which is part of Shaw’s transparency.

Step 5C: Choose and write final hook
Chosen: [Failure-to-success arc]—it balances honesty, curiosity, and data. Final hook:

15 months of failing. Then, my first $10k+ month as an independent AI creator (full breakdown inside).

Step 6:
Draft of full post:

15 months of failing. Then, my first $10k+ month as an independent AI creator (full breakdown inside).

After leaving my job, I spent over a year trying to make independent income. Most experiments didn’t work—lots of pivots, wrong turns, and lessons. Then this month, things came together for the first time:

Here’s exactly how the month broke down:

- AI Builders Bootcamp: $9,265.48
- Medium (blog): $894.52
- YouTube: $542.73
- Consulting calls: $363.21

Total: $10,826.72

What stood out: the power of stacking multiple income streams, instead of betting on just one. Each failed project still helped me grow skills and reach, eventually leading here.

It’s still the beginning, but this gives me hope that small, consistent work adds up.

What would you add or change in your own journey—do you rely on one stream, or are you stacking them too?

Step 7:
- Em dash audit: Only one em dash, used for parenthetical clarity. Acceptable.
- No repeated words/phrases in the hook or opening.
- Hook and body are different.
- Literal language throughout, no business clichés or idioms.
- White space and bullet points for scannability.
- CTA invites technical/practical engagement (income breakdowns, stream focus). Clear and literal.
- Cross-referenced with example-2: matches style and level of transparency.
- Honest, factual, educational—practical insight is about income streams and persistence.

Step 8:
final_post:
15 months of failing. Then, my first $10k+ month as an independent AI creator (full breakdown inside).

After leaving my job, I spent over a year trying (and mostly failing) to make it as a solopreneur. Lots of pivots, experiments, and learning—most of which didn’t work out.

But this month, it finally came together:

- AI Builders Bootcamp: $9,265.48
- Medium (blog): $894.52
- YouTube: $542.73
- Consulting calls: $363.21

Total: $10,826.72

The biggest lesson? Stack multiple income streams. Most experiments failed, but each one helped me build new skills and reach. It took time, but the progress compounds—slowly.

Curious: what’s your own income breakdown from independent projects, or which stream are you most interested in exploring?
